Very good storytelling and almost perfect puzzle design. Highly recommended!

Play Portal first.

Includes a co-op campaign as well. Definitely worth to play if you have a friend to play it with. You can also play co-op on a single computer with split screen. Though you need to mess around a bit in the console to achieve this UNLESS you have two gamepads. http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=1847904

Also, there is a database in-game with community created maps to play, both single player and co-op. You can rank the maps based on rating or popularity to find the best maps.
10/10 - There is no game like this.
You still don't have Portal 2 ?

The incredible sequel after the amazing Portal experience.  More insane puzzles, more crazy dialougue and more weird atmosphere than you can handle...
As Valve said: The first game was a try-out, but this is truly a full-fledged game where nothing is missing. And I fully agree. Be sure to check out the co-operative perpetual testing initiative!

This so-called premier first person not bullet and war zone man shooter is a total imitation of Little Big Planet. You "Customize" your little dolls and shoot "high-fives".  You can also create and share up to a gazillion levels and make your own. A fraction of all of these will be good and it will be endearing. 
Has:
Pick up cube in this timeless classic of willing silent FPS protagonist against the perils of go forward or get mad at your friend who hasn't played it before in rich co op. Paints in multiple colors. Not Brown.
Lacks:
Bullet time and shooting the boss creature's true form in the face. Michael Bay Memories. A funky surfboard section where everyone just hangs 10 for a while would have been cool.

Portal 2 is the sequel to the award-winning Puzzle game, Portal and it is a must-play in every respect.

Portal 2 does exactly the same as the original but better. The puzzles are huge and expansive, with new ways to solve them. New items, such as the blue and orange gels as well as the light bridge and the small catapult, change the way puzzles are handled giving you more unique ways to solve them.

Portal 2 also has a story! It is a bit more complex this time with a dumb but shady AI core named Wheatley and the ever brooding GLaDOS coming back into the fray. This time, Portal is more intense, more hilarious and more intriguing than ever!

Furthermore, Portal 2 has also added a full-on co-op campaign for you and a friend to try. With Steam Workshop being thrown into the mix, you'll be playing this game for hours not knowing when to stop!
would recomend for those who are willing to take the time to solve all the tests and like to think outside of the box. other than that, its  a real head turner when it comes to co-op.

A diverse game that will challange the mind! Very fun.

If you live or have liced under a rock for some time and don't know what Portal 2 is, it's a [strike]survival horror[/strike] puzzle game where you have to make your way through 'test chambers' (levels) for science using a gun called the portal gun. How it basically works is you can shoot 2 different colored portals and walking through one will bring you to the other, essentially point a to point b. That's not all you can do with them but I won't spoil anything. Playing the first game is not really nessesary to play this one but there are story elements which would make more sense if you have. After you finish the single player the game dosn't end there! There is multiplayer where you [strike]battle to the death[/stike] work together to solve puzzles as well as lots of community maps (also including multiplayer). I'll give it a 9.5/10 because nothing is perfect :P

This game is extremely awesome!  I would reccommend playing Portal before Portal 2, but this game is one that exceeds all expectations.  The game is fun and tough, with humor and great replay value.  There are many custom made test chambers to do after you've completed the story mode.  Playing coop adds even more to the great gameplay and replay.  If you want to spend money well.  Buy this game!

Awesome game, brings back Half Life memories. World is breath-taking at times, you should play on a large monitor to appreciate it though! Cool, surprizing ending :)

From difficult brain teaser's involving almost a half hour to figure out and plan, to obvious press the button and the level is immediately beat, This game has a wide variety of levels in it. But not just that: The voice acting is top notch, The graphics are amazing even on the lowest settings, and the dialouge is hilarious; having me legitamitaly rolling around with laughter. And then after you beat the game there is a ton of other levels to do in co-op with a firend or random person, AND THEN after that you can play countless user-created levels. You are almost paying for everything. 

Summarize- The game is so good you even get the moon. Literally.

As a sequel to Portal (A must play before this), this game delivers challenging puzzles and mind boggling levels. Very fun and difficult puzzle game, this game will have you sitting down for hours as you attempt to beat the very long but fulfilling campaign! You can also create and share maps you create, and download and play others' maps. A must own for any gamer!

Amazing, Valve has done it again. Every moment of this game from start to finish is brilliant. The puzzles are arranged in a way that no matter what your skill level the game will teach you how to complete each puzzle but still present extremely challanging scenarios. The story is exceptional with one of the greatest endings of all time (no spoilers!) I recommend this game to everyone and anyone, but I'd also recommend playing the orinal first to understand the storyline. 10/10

Just as good as the previous one, although with expansion of the surroundings and endless pits and ceilings Portal 2 leant more towards cosmesis than its predecessor. The newly added components of the game meant that your brain needs an extra few gears to figure out the puzzles and Portal once more became a novelty. However just like its precedessor, it has no replayability values: once you get through a chamber you don't really want to go back. Being able to explore the past background of the first game is a truly wonderful idea, suddenly all the experimentation makes sense. Sort of. The coop aspect is wonderful and extremely funny if you have someone you know and talk to partnering you. Working out the timing and knowing where to go makes each session last longer and much more memorable. Ten thumbs up, just like the first game. Very unexpected ending!
